div.p: VPRS 5831/PO/7, correspondence inward — miscellaneous letters, p. 142, VA 912 Trustees of the Public Library, Museums and National Gallery of Victoria 1869-1944, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS annotation by R. Berry: 'Mr Sheffield be so good as to say whet. you have this work'. 14/4/78.

Recently, dear Sir Redmond, I received from Dulau & Co of Soho Square a copy of the extremely rare "systema naturae" of Linné,
Linnaeus (1735); there is no copy listed in Public Library, Museums, and National Gallery [of Victoria] (1861), but there is a copy listed in Public Library of Victoria (1880), p. 794. M owned a copy of the 'edition reformata' (i.e. Linné (1776-8)); see M to J. McCulloch, 30 September 1865 (B65.10.01), which also lists the title without edition number, as well as Gmelin's editon (Linné (1789-91)). a work valued so much as it gave the first outlines of the Linnéan System & fixed many genera, before the "genera plantarum" were published. Mess Dulau thought to have conferred on me an extreme favor by securing this copy for five £, but I am too poor to purchase even the most needful recent works, after my Department became destroyed and nearly all votes withdrawn from me. I shall send the work back again, unless you like to secure this rare literary treasure for the public Library.
